results.title: Elegant girl or the drive for reliability
results.brief_description: A musical advertisement for the Vauxhall motor car. Makes a technical comparison between vintage and later model cars and shows the detailed testing the modern Vauxhall goes through to ensure its all-round quality and performance is at a maxiumum.

results.title: Electrostatics II
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Deals with electromagnetic induction, a single turn generator, modern large power stations, the transmission of electricity, currents in electrical equipment, ring mains, electromagnetic damping and forces on conductors. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Electrostatics I
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Deals with Coulombic attraction and repulsion, Perrin’s tube, the charge on electrons, electrostatic charges on carpets, xerography, electrostatic precipitation, electrostatic charge on liquids, electrostatic generators, lightning conductors and capacitors. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Electrostatic charges and forces
results.brief_description: This film shows how positive and negative charges are created: defines such basic concepts as insulator, conductor and electric field; and introduces Coulomb’s law, used to measure electrostatic charges. A laboratory demonstration of Faraday’s ice-pail experiment is presented. The film also shows how the principles of electrostatic charges and forces can be used to explain the operation of the Van de Graaff generator.
results.description: This film shows how positive and negative charges are created: defines such basic concepts as insulator, conductor and electric field; and introduces Coulomb’s law, used to measure electrostatic charges. results.title: Electronics: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Victor and Ellen Landweber and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Follows the development of electronic devices: a conductor, an electric light bulb, a diode vacuum tube, an amplifier, and the transistor. Concludes with a brief survey of electronic applications. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Electron arrangement and bonding
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: chemistry”.
The purpose of these six episodes is to show the importance of the electron to chemical compunds. Illustrates the development of the atomic model by scientists such as Bohr, Rutherford and Planch, and relates their contributions to an understanding of the function of electrons. Highlights various aspects of energy levels, orbitals, charges, relative mass, bonding and electron configuration. Includes: 1. “Introduction to the players”, 2. “The Rutherford-Bohr atom”, 3. “Electron arrangement”, 4. “How atoms bond”, 5. “Molecular substance and covalent crystals”, 6. “Metals and ionic solids.”

results.title: Electromagnets and their uses
results.brief_description: Shows how electricity can be used to make magnets, and presents various applications of electromagnets. Describes the effects of coiling a wire and adding a core, and demonstrates the effect of current direction on polarity. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Electromagnetism
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
The historical discovery of the magnetic properties of lodestone led to a scientific understanding of Earth’s magnetic field. Six ten minute computer-animated episodes explore this mysterious force from early experiments to the concepts of electromagnetic induction, the motor principle, generators, and transformers. It also looks at fascinating modern theories about the role of the Earth’s magnetic field in the extinction of species and at the ways that animals use it for navigation. The programs include: 1. Earth’s magnetic field 4. The Motor principle 2. Magnetism and electron flow 5. Electromagnetic induction 3. Domain theory 6. Life in the field
